reviewText: This video like the ones before it does not disappoint. It shows kids doing activities like learning to ride a bike, asking the WHY question, playing a sound games, filling up water balloons, and more. Your child will be able to watch other kids interacting with each other without the pressure to . Once they have seen the video a few times they can put some of what they have learned into practice and customize from there.

I ordered almost all of these for my 3-year-old nephew who was diagnosed on the autism spectrum. His mom says that he will just sit and watch them and that they have been really good in helping him with social skills and verbalizing.
